type: match specific individual with quasi identifiers
external data: detailed non-census county demographic data \& public arrest records
remedy: suppress quasi identifiers in small cells (k-anonymity) | noisy/subsampled data | exclusion of observations below k-anonymity threshold

type: match specific individual with quasi identifiers
external data: awareness that a known individual was arrested
remedy: suppress qausi identifiers in small cells (k-anonymity) | noisy/subsampled data

type: match specific group with quasi identifiers
disclosure: sensitive values if are homogeneous in group
remedy: aggregate so that groups are large enough to be heterogeneous (l-diversity); noisy/subsampled data

type: match arbitrary individual/group with quasi identifiers [is arbitrary individual the same as fishing?]

exclude matches using complete demographic attribute data of arrested individuals to link a demographically rare individual to a specific offense
external data: OBTS, court records [both are very unlikely to be complete]

type: exclude matches using complete arrest attribute data from another source to find demographically rare individuals
external data: public arrest records and detailed non-census county demographic data
remedy: perform anonymization on a conservatively selected, released subset to prevent complement from adding risk; l-diversity on demographic keys of offense codes
